title: 111_hr3380
content: The Act titled "Promoting Lending to America's Small Businesses Act of 2009" amends limits on member business loans and defines member business loans under the Federal Credit Union Act. It also imposes restrictions on member business loans unless approved by the Board. SEC. 5 amends the Federal Credit Union Act to exclude loans to nonprofit religious organizations. SEC. 6 encourages small business development in underserved urban and rural communities. SEC. 5 amends the Federal Credit Union Act to exclude loans to nonprofit religious organizations. Amendment includes loans for commercial, business, farm, or agricultural purposes in underserved areas. The curr_chunk discusses loans secured by real property in underserved areas or intended for local businesses, excluding nationwide operations. The curr_chunk defines an underserved area as a geographic area meeting specific criteria for a low-income community. The curr_chunk specifies that an underserved area must meet certain criteria, including being designated under specific acts and having less than 50% of resident families with incomes over $75,000. The curr_chunk clarifies that a Federal credit union's geographic area must have received approval and established a service facility before a certain date.
